units.title: Place sections on 96‑well coverslip and attach to superstructure
units.text: sections were placed on a 96-well format coverslip that was subsequently attached to a 96-well superstructure allowing immunohistological treatment, followed by imaging and antibody elution.
units.rationale: Enables high‑throughput immunohistological processing of multiple sections.

units.title: Perform 21 immunohistochemical cycles
units.rationale: Generates multiplexed protein data across many staining rounds.

units.title: Acquire tiled images at ×40 magnification
units.text: Images were acquired at ×40 magnification with a high‑NA silicone oil objective, tiled across the tissue.
units.rationale: Collects high‑resolution, large‑area image data for downstream analysis.

units.title: Segment nuclei
units.rationale: Identifies individual cell nuclei for quantitative measurements.

units.title: Denoise image data
units.rationale: Reduces imaging noise to improve downstream segmentation and clustering.

units.title: Register image stacks
units.rationale: Aligns successive staining cycles to a common coordinate system.

units.title: Pixel clustering of MTUs
units.rationale: Groups pixels into molecular tissue units (MTUs) based on protein expression patterns.

units.title: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE sections
units.text: perform multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3‑μm‑thick formalin‑fixed, paraffin‑embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample).
units.rationale: Applies the 4i workflow to standard histological specimens.

units.title: Establish antibody panel
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and signaling pathways.
units.rationale: Provides comprehensive protein coverage for cell‑type identification.

units.title: Generate tiled images covering millimeter‑to‑nanometer scales
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high‑numerical‑aperture silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 µm).
units.rationale: Enables multiscale visualization from tissue‑level to subcellular detail.
